attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Ban residential bonfires during Summer.
attributes.background:
We don't get too many sunny days in the UK, but when we do you know someone locally will be having a bonfire! 

I want to petition the government to stop residential bonfires during the summer months from when the clocks go forward until the clocks go back.

attributes.action: Close all remaining 'City' zoo's.
attributes.background: After the events this bank holiday weekend, we feel enough is enough. No longer shall we pay to see animals held in closed captivity. City zoo's across the country should be closed. With such great places as West Midlands safari etc there is no need for city zoo's, anymore.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a varietyâ€‹ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: Contribution to cost of teachers' holidays during Half-term and Summer holidays
attributes.background: Teachers work very hard for little pay. Often they cannot afford the holidays they deserve during their only allocated holiday time, as prices skyrocket during school holidays.
attributes.additional_details: As many people are aware prices to travel abroad or even to enjoy a holiday in the UK skyrocket outside of term time (during school holidays and half term). While parents have the option to take students out of school to avoid such price hikes teachers do not, as it is their duty to teach every single day. I believe teachers should receive a discount or monetary contribution towards holidays during half-term and Summer holidays.

attributes.action: Referendum to change Britain into a secular republic with an elected  president.
attributes.background: We must give the British people a voice over the one that has stolen our voice.
attributes.additional_details: It's an embarrassment to democracy for us to have an unelected head of state. The Monarchy system is old fashioned and out-dated. Not only is it undemocratic but the British taxpayer spends billions of pounds to an the British monarchy when it could be used to save the NHS and solve the housing crisis in Britain. British society is based on meritocracy and how can Britain claim this with a rich blood-line monarchy which is based on birth.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 14
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 14 so that this give a better chance for the young to have a go

attributes.action: Independent, more stringent scrutiny of MPs' interests, influences & conflicts
attributes.background: Need independent body with more stringent rules/codes on all historical, current & planned outside interests, potential influences & conflicts of interests, & their full declaration, so our elected/non-elected representatives work to the highest ethical & moral standards that engender public trust.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM & all MPs/candidates should be scrutinised by an independent body using more stringent, clear rules & do the honourable thing accordingly.

1.	Aim is to increase public trust in our democratic process & our politicians.
2.	Need to minimise conflicts of interest/influence that might bias MPsâ€™ opinions, decisions, actions etc. (including investments, corporate/foreign deals, donations, second jobs, consultancies etc.); need full declarations at point of potential impact.
3.	Need transparency based on plain-English declarations of conflicts (not just posting tax returns that can hide all kinds of other investments/financial interests).

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Please include a 'Return to Sender Address' on your pro-EU Referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: Include a return to sender address
attributes.additional_details: 16 pages of unsolicited mail requires a return to sender address.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the worldâ€™s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBCâ€™s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action:
Pay carers fair rate
Currently get Â£73.10wk for35 hrs of care
That's Â£2.08ph
attributes.background:
Adult carer's currently get Â£2.08 per hour for providing up to 35 hours of care a week,
The minimum wage is currently Â£6.70 for over 21.
Let's improve the quality of life for BOTH cared for and carer's PLEASE.
I hear if you are a member of house of Lords you get Â£350.00 a day for just turning up.
attributes.additional_details:
I am an Independent disabled man.
I was damaged by accidents during surgery.
I need a fair amount of care at times.

attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: Make it law that employees are given a day off in lieu for 29 February.
attributes.background: Regardless of what day of the week 29 February falls on, ultimately every 4 years employees are expected to work an extra day, without additional pay. Employers should give employees an extra day off work in lieu every 4 years.

attributes.action: Ban and shoot down drones flying near airports before the inevitable happens.
attributes.background:
Did we get enough near misses to realise that we have a problem?
Drones can now carry a 10 lbs charge, which could destroy an airplane in midair.

Each airport needs military equipment to track down and neutralise drones that violate the restricted airspace.

attributes.action: Provide better support, funding and awareness for epilepsy patients and families
attributes.background: This is something close to my heart. We sadly lost hayley aged 20 in 2015 to sudep, sudden death caused by an epileptic seizure. Please sign this petition to help raise awareness and funding for this horrible illness. Im seeing more and more tragic losses due to the illness, young lives being lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Sudep action
Epilepsy Scotland

attributes.action: Keep Bishop Auckland urgent care open
attributes.background: They are proposing that they close the urgent care centre in bishop hospital. It is a vital service which has saved two members of my own family and possibly thousands more.
attributes.additional_details: We need to keep it open for the benefit of the population of bishop and surrounding areas. If it closes then I can imagine that death rate would increase dramatically

attributes.action: Allow buyer to retain 5% of new build house price until build quality is correct
attributes.background: I am a new home owner. A year after moving in, I am fighting the house builder to complete my home to a satisfactory standard. Many of my neighbours are in a similar position. An incentive must be provided for the house builder to complete the house to the required quality standards.
attributes.additional_details: The house builder currently is paid the full amount of the house on exchange no matter how poor the quality of house delivered. New home buyers need more protection - the 10 year warranty is not sufficient to protect against poor quality. If the home buyer can retain 5% of the purchase price, then if the home builder cannot deliver the home to the required cosmetic and structural quality (which can be independently verified), then the home buyer should be allowed to keep the retained capital.

attributes.action: Introduce incentives for every building to install Solar panels.
attributes.background: The Government should make a real economic investment for the future of the UK's energy security by giving real economic incentives for every home, business, factory, school in the UK to have Solar panels fitted.
attributes.additional_details:
If every home, business, factory, school had Solar panels.
1) They would generate much of their own electrical needs
2) Excess energy goes into the national grid reducing the need for more power stations
3) Gives the UK the biggest renewable power station
4) Ensures the future energy security of the UK
5) Would greatly cut greenhouse emission
6) Makes the UK a world leader in renewable energy and Green

attributes.action: Help Save Children with Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Children with Neuroblastoma face many months of intense treatment but the chances of relapse are high. There is treatment in the USA that reduces this risk but that has to be funded privately.
The amount of money that is needed to pay for this runs in to hundreds of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of recent cases in the media where families of children with this cancer were trying to raise Â£550,000 to get this treatment in America. If the treatment is available to reduce the risk we should be providing that treatment here in the UK.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Return the District Councils to Cornwall
attributes.background:
Since Cornwall Council was formed it has wasted so much money. 

It is time for the government to return Cornwall to District Councils and to abolish Cornwall Council.

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - Â£1

Such a small amount per person will generate Â£100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = Â£9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = Â£2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = Â£0.3m
Total = Â£12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised Â£87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: Hear the voices of the young adult disabled fighting to be heard
attributes.background: From the age of 18 young disabled people are put into the adult age bracket, but little or nothing is offered for this age group. Overnight they lose majority of the help given to children and do not come into account again until they become pensioners. Though mentally they are still children.
attributes.additional_details: Young adults are forgotten when it comes to living as normal a life as possible. Government need to make it law that they are entitled to the same as childrens services instead of leaving it to their parents. Some of who are elderly or even disabled themselves.

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Review the child maintenance calculations, in order to make them fairer.
attributes.background:
The child maintenance calculations are unfair to the paying parent, due to the method of calculation. I am asking the relevant Secretary of State to review these calculations and to make them fairer to both the paying and receiving parents. 

This should also include a cap in maintenance payable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Maintenance Service uses the tax data from HMRC in order to calculate gross income. This also includes any taxable benefits that are not received as cash. They also have a 20% tolerance for any changes in income (up or down).

This can mean that a paying parent can be on an income of Â£50,000 a year, with a company car and company fuel, and any other benefits such as private health etc, could be seen to have a gross income of Â£60,000 (even though they pay tax on these benefits). Also, due to the tolerance in place, they will not review income changes (even a reduction in income) if it is less than 20% change.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Scrap interest rates on student loans.
attributes.background: Interest charged on student loans should be scrapped for everyone who has one and for students of the future. The continual rise in the interest charged is making paying the loans back even harder and unfair.

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Sizeably increase and improve upon current funding for domestic abuse refuges.
attributes.background: Between early 2015 and '16, 30 refuges were forced to close as a result of inadequate funding. There are currently 272 refuges across the UK, sharing between them just Â£20 million of annual government funding. This lack of funding is, in part, responsible for 2 domestic female homicides every week.
attributes.additional_details: Domestic abuse refuges save lives. But they are in dire straits; scarce government funding serves merely to 'patch up' issues which reemerge in exacerbated form each year. Refuges have excessively suffered from recent spending cuts, with 44% of services in 2015 operating without any reliable funding over the previous year. On just one day in 2015, 167 women and children were turned away from 129 refuges nationwide, with 23.27% of referrals in said year being declined out of financial necessity.

attributes.action: To prevent women from serving in frontline infantry units
attributes.background: In order to prevent a drop in morale among male ranks currently serving in frontline units.

attributes.action: Make rail companies social enterprises instead of profit-making parasites
attributes.background: The shambolic performance of Southern rail shows that the system is broken. People are in fear of losing their jobs because they cannot reliably get a train to work. Parents spend little time with their children because of delayed journeys home. Who and what are the rail companies for?

attributes.action:
Outlaw Investor-State Dispute Settlements
(Investors Suing the U.K. Government)
attributes.background: Investor-State Dispute Settlement clauses in trade deals provide a means for foreign investors to sue governments for policies which harm their profits. If successful, taxpayer money is used to pay damages to them. A government can thus be more beholden to corporations than the public they serve.
attributes.additional_details:
The TTIP trade agreement contains one such ISDS clause. The Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) and Trade In Services Agreement (TISA) have one also. 
Secretly negotiated, they ensure foreign corps are able to sue 2/3 of the world's governments and block trade with the emerging economies of China, Brazil, Russia, India and S. Africa. 
Examples:
Vattenfall vs Germany for phasing out nuclear energy ($3.7bn)
Veolia vs Egypt (introducing a minimum wage)
B.A.T. vs Australia (tobacco advertising laws)

attributes.action: Make GCSE politics and law compulsory.
attributes.background: The EU referendum results showed that people are easily manipulated by media and propaganda and should have a good basis understanding of law and politics before they should be able to decide the future of the country.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Highlight the serious issue of mental health as a top Government priority.
attributes.background:
We believe that the Government should prioritise the issue of mental health as a priority.
The issue of mental health affects many families including both adults and children.
We feel that the time has come for Government to be more proactive in addressing this very serious area.

attributes.action: Make all 'Brexit' discussions open to public scrutiny.
attributes.background:
Transparency within the European Union has been a real concern since its conception, it was also a significant argument in the Brexit 'debate'.

In a democracy the elected are accountable to the electorate and accountability demands transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have made the decision to leave the EU and they have the right to hear all the negotiations conducted in their name.

We call on David Cameron and all other UK representatives not to enter any negotiations unless they are fully minuted and broadcast live via radio or television.

Furthermore, we call upon our government officials to insist any 'Brexit' negotiations held by our EU partners which exclude UK representatives be fully minuted and broadcast live.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36353013
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.
